Title.evidence: Risk Factors for Serious Hypotension Following Intravenous Acetaminophen in Hematologic Malignancies: A Retrospective Case-Control Study

Participants.evidence: hospitalized patients with hematologic malignancies who received intravenous AAP

Intervention.evidence: patients with hematologic malignancies who received intravenous AAP

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to identify risk factors associated with this adverse event.

Number_Analysed.evidence: The serious hypotension group comprised 37 patients, while the control group included 111 patients

Result_Outcome.evidence: Elevated body temperature prior to administration (OR 9.81, 95% CI 3.49–27.53), acute kidney injury (OR 14.99, 95% CI 3.13–71.87), and bacteremia (OR 6.36, 95% CI 2.01–20.11) were identified as significant risk factors

Harms.evidence: Adverse events were more frequent in the serious hypotension group, with 64.9% developing septic shock.
